intro:
NIP - No Important Person
English/German language
I use Arch Linux and like Open Source Software
***
Visit my **[Tusiko's Tavern](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N/ "Tusiko's Tavern")**
***
Besuche **[Tusiko's Taverne](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NXqUXrG2KiTv2bo9ttCn2WnR4dJv1dQ6U/ "Tusiko's Taverne")** (deutschsprachig).
***
Be welcome to **[Contact me](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=tusiko)**

post.body: Hello ZeroMe!

I use the Tor network, I2P and Freenet. But 0net is going to be my favourite deep web. I am new to 0net, but I like it very much.
I2P and Freenet are very good but sooo slow. Tor is really fast and good but 0net with using the bitcoin technique is interesting. Hosting zites serverless is a big point for me as well. I thing, I will stay here for longer time. :-)
Does anybody know, if it is possible to make a second ID in Zeronet?
It's raining and cold outside. A sofa, a laptop, a coffee and - time for Zeronet. Nice weekend.
How secure is the download of a file in Zeronet? It is well known that downloading files in I2P is anonymous and secure. But how is it here? Could my IP get traced when I'm using Zeronet with Tor?
Weird. I muted a user here. And the next day I see his posts again. Does the Mute function really work?
I actually changed the server and my Zeronet is now running on a Raspberry Pi 3 24/7 with Tor as a security layer. On Freenet or I2P a 24/7 server helps the network. How is it with Zeronet?

Just a small test. I tried to insert some images in my blog.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N/?Home
Does anybody see them?

**Former Dark Web Operator of DiDW Questioned on Arms Dealing**
The former operator of DiDW was questioned about drugs and weapons dealing on an online portal Thursday in court. He is facing charges for operating and moderating an online dark web marketplace which trades illegal products and services. Businesses on the forum are conducted exclusively in cryptocurrencies.
Onion Address: http://deepdot35wvmeyd5.onion/2018/12/12/former-dark-web-operator-of-didw-questioned-on-arms-dealing/
Good night everybody and stay wild.
I wonder why not more users are on [ZeroVoat](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1J1c7eML6uMwDU4uiKbKRxoqxGP6WMFMvb/ "ZeroVoat"). Seems to be a good thing, similar to Reddit and with anonymous ID's.
Good morning friends. Have a nice weekend.
Snow is falling down here. Okay, the winter is coming now. Time for a sofa and a good summer movie. :-)

I am actually playing a bit with [IPFS](https://ipfs.io/ "IPFS") (ext. Link!). It seems to be usable but I don't exactly what to do with it. So far as I can see, I can upload any data including a whole website. Hmmm. The advantage is that this data is usable from the normal clearnet. Interesting. I should read more about it.

Good morning friends. This is a good morning because I muted two stupid religious fanatics. Now the timeline is a bit cleaner.

I never tolerate racism or fanaticism. Both are evidences for simple minded people or narcissism.  We can only stop this stupidity with education but I doubt if this helps at some people.

In my eyes every discussion about those silly kinds of humans is obsolete. The best way is not to give them a stage. 

Coffee anybody?

Meinen neuen Blog Tusiko's Taverne gibt es jetzt deutschsprachig.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NXqUXrG2KiTv2bo9ttCn2WnR4dJv1dQ6U
 
Der englischsprachige Blog Tusiko's Tavern bleibt nat√ºrlich aktiv.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N
Very silent here today. Everybody sleeping? :-)

When I like to reply to a comment on my ZeroBlog I get the following error about signing the content. The resource of the blog is at 42% of 10 MB. I can read the comment, when I reload the page. Does anybody has an idea?
Here the error:

I tested for some time now ZeroNet with Tor on my Raspberry Pi 3. It works like a charm and I let a IPFS daemon run nearby. The result of my experience is [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N/?Post:22:ZeroNet,+Tor+and+IPFS+on+a+Raspberry+Pi) to find. I finished testing this configuration and let it run as my daily remote ZeroNet and IPFS machine 24/7 for long term use. As I connect with ssh to this machine I can use it from every computer in the house and my tablet, when I am moving around outside (With VPN and Juice). That is very comfortable for me and ZeroNet is always with me. :-)

I would like to help ZeroNet with my knowledge. Unfortunately I am no developer (I know python, but not good enough).
But my native language is German and I could translate the ZeroNet documentation or other help sites. I saw that many pages in the documentation are only translated into France.
I think @NoFrog is too busy but perhaps somebody else can give me a hint to figure out how I can help ZeroNet with my translation knowledge.
You can even mail me.

Yesterday I tried out the chat Thunderwave [http://127.0.0.1:43110/thunderwave.bit/](http://127.0.0.1:43110/thunderwave.bit/).
It heavily slowed down my browser. It is for me more or less unusable. Does anybody else have this problem?

If you are really bored and need to be instantly thrilled, just do what I've done a few minutes ago.
Requirements: 2 different websites in Zeronet.
Assuming that you have a blog with some posts, you don't like to loose. And assuming that you like to update your other website.
You write a long post, copies everything to the Zeronet "server" and now you look for the right address folder.
Well, if you take the wrong address (from your blog with important data) and then you copy the whole content of the updated Website (you know - the other one) into it - and recognizes immediately what happens...
...then it is too late. Argh. 
It is nice to see, that you now have two identical website. One is pretty good, the other totally shit.

I opened the folder on the console and deleted all folders and files, I knew from the other website. Then, my heartbeat increases, I deleted the index.html. And reload the site.

Fortunately Zeronet rebuilt the index file and my old content was back. Everything is fine again.

Now I need a coffee and a cigarette...

A short introduction to Puppy Linux, even good for Zeronet:
[http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N/?Post:24:A+view+to+Puppy+Linux+-+My+favorite+one](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N/?Post:24:A+view+to+Puppy+Linux+-+My+favorite+one)
Back to Zeronet after an opulent brunch with the whole (yes, the whole) family. To full as to do anything else, I am just lying on the sofa with my laptop. Trying not to fall asleep...
Even a dwarf is celebrating Christmas. At least he is also there.

Christmas is also a holiday of silence. 
At least when the rest of my big family is gone to bed. üòÇ
All kids are here with wife/girlfriend and the whole day was a lot going on. After a short rest after brunch all was going on again. I am so happy when all of my family are here, but in the evening I am happy too when the silence is back. A wonderful day. üôÇ

Here is a good guide for average and advanced users in the deep web.

[**Surveillance
Self-Defense**](https://ssd.eff.org/)
(clear net!)

Tips, Tools and How-tos for Safer Online Communications
A Project of the Electronic Frontier Foundation

I notice, my smartphone is more then 5 years old and the battery is getting badder now (2. battery till now). As the old Android 4.4.4 is very outdated, time has come to search a new phone.
I would like to wait for the _Purism Librem 5_ which shall be sold from April 2019 on. But we know how often such deadlines will be moved into the future. We will see when it will come out.
I research a little bit, which smartphone is the best for me. If I could choose, I would take Linux as OS, but there is no good one on the market. 
At least I need one, where I can install Lineage OS or similar ROM's to get rid off Google. If someone has a tip, drop a line pls.
Even Amazon makes a failure. The left example should be a Sony Sailfish OS smartphone. At least it was the plan. üòÇ
Good night Europe. Take care about our Zeronet.

I published a short article about ZeroNet at WEKU:
https://deals.weku.io/community-deals/@mameko/introducing-zeronet-the-decentralized-network
I hope to welcome the one or other new user here. :-)

I am happy. My post at Weku (see my last post 3 h ago) has been voted to get upvoted in a special christmas/new year "contest" (made for new users). That means, this article will be pushed to get more publicity.
Good for our Zeronet!
Good morning everybody. Let's start the last day in this old year!

My message for Sylvester:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FMGApV8HfFdq8wX8vvfn27twHhyFPVM7N/?Post:29:Happy+New+Year!

comment.body: @Styromaniac: thanks for your advice. I've found it now.
@Triggerhappy: No, thx
You found it.

@~Publicality~: There are several ID services in Zeronet. As an example, try KaffieID. Look here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1K3tM7irQqSX4Hx3JvNgkimkQzY6jPtBfz
This is my hope. ;-)
@~Publicality~: It's up to us.
@~Publicality~: Right. But this is the only information I could gather so far. You can make a second ID, but it shall be a bit tricky. Pershaps @Styromaniac know more about that.
@Pexo: Thanks for your detailed answer. I will be patient till Zeronet over I2P works. Good to know.
The baddest day is over here. The rest of the week could be fine. :-)
@Thunder: I think so.
No idea, but this I like to know as well.
I made a fresh Zeronet install and try it again for testing purpose.
@xeu100: Okay, good to know. Thanks

Very weird. I installed Zeronet new on my other machine and imported the sites.json and user.json. And....
Here are all muted users blocked, haha. Okay, seems to work now. I have to unmute some people... ;-)
@xeu100: This could be the reason. Yes.
That sounds very good.
Welcome on Zeronet ;-)
You can ask your questions right here or you can use ZeroTalk as well. Perhaps another new user can read them too.
@Realjohndoe: Alright. Thanks a lot! üòä
@Schiz0: Oh, I'm sorry. ;-)
Looks good so far. :-)
@Diligentslacker: No Problem ;-)
@Nofish: Great job, thanks
The dirty clearweb is full of porn. I'm happy not to see them here too often.

@~Publicality~: I use darknets for long years now and I am not afraid to be de-anonymized. I thank for your advice. New users should remember that, because it is important to know. 
I am from Germany and do even some posts in German language. Everybody can read this. That doesn't matter for me. Here are living 80 million people. ;-)
That is really true.
A good attitude.
This depends on your router. There are many different router with different software inside. It is good to read the routers manual for that or to ask your search engine.
Yes. You can search in ZeroHallo for both.

@Quantumworld: Open **ZeroHallo**. On the upper side you see a field to search in connected sites. Put in your query and you get the result immediately. Search with text or hashtag. You get results from **all** connected sites, including ZeroMe.
Good night :-)
@Quantumworld: No. To test it, I chose a text from ZeroMe, which is **not** from my ZeroHello timeline. The search finds everything.

Look here. 11 hours ago:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/19ev8HmfPQ2VC8aWDA4Ck7E2vLYDYFgw9P/1544989405

@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: Great job! This works with
site:zerotalk and others as well. Very good to know!
@nekololi: If you like to be in the stone ages, try Freenet (sorry Freenet).
@Znnex: :-)
Why do I see a white blank field instead of my screenshot? Weird...
@nekololi: Sorry, my fault. Yes, I forgot to sign and publish it. Now done.
@Diligentslacker: Yes, I always use the tor browser with Zeronet. This was the mistake. I got it now. Thx.
I have Zeronet running on a little Raspberry Pi and connect via ssh from my Laptop. Zerome is working fast without any issues. Unfortunately I cannot help you.

@K0rsairpt: I am just using the default configuration. Only difference is that I use Tor -always. Nothing special.

Juice is a SSH-app at Google play store with port forwarding. Very good. I use it every day.
@Pexo: Thanks for this information. I will have a look.

@Pexo: Okay. The process on Github seems to be complicated. I never worked with Github and don't know what to do, without making mistakes.
Tomorrow I will make a PR and try to follow the Github help [https://help.github.com/articles/about-pull-requests/](https://help.github.com/articles/about-pull-requests/).
@Pexo: Thanks for your advice. I do not use Raspbian. I installed Arch Linux ArmV7 32bit. But I will look for some documentation due to that.

You can make a new empty website with ZeroHello. There you can store files and link to them. But this works only if you are online and share this site till you have more than 1 peer.
An elegant way is to publish a little website with some interesting content, which will be shared from some other peers. Then store a file in that folder and you can share everything, even without being online.

And or course - on IFS. See the link below.
It is pretty cool. :-)
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: I read both posts and will wait till the next Zeronet version. Then I'll test it again.
I got it now. I opened thunderwave.bit again and went away from the laptop. 15 minutes later I was back and now it is not slow anymore. I think there were some files to download first. Now it works.
@Nofish: I always use the Tor Browser. But it is okay now. I just waited some minutes and now the website runs normal. Thank you.
@Realjohndoe: Absolutely right!

@Thunder: And in the meantime the site will be shared on to more peers perhaps. A shutdown can be nearly impossible. If a site has 100 peers, the govs have to identify all 100 of them. In an anonymous network.
@Klu9: The first time I had the same problem. Open the chat and just wait some minutes. Then you can go into the settings and it should work. In my browser it works nice now, even the settings.

@~Publicality~: That is a thing, Freenet does much better. If there is a content published, there is absolutely no way to delete it. You can delete all content of your site (even if you are forced to do that), but Freenet has a versioning system. Users can just open the former version of your site and all content in there. This is real censorship resistance. :-)

Zeronet needs a tool to resist censorship.
Welcome :-)
Welcome. What a great picture!
@Diligentslacker: Really good!

@Pexo: I am absolutely happy with ZeroNet, how it is. I don't need a versioning system and I think to build one would need much, much effort. 
You devs do a great job!
@Trey: Welcome :-)
The flat is crooked. :-)

Depends on: "What is interesting?"
There is much good stuff around you. Just take a look.
@Realjohndoe: That sounds like a plan. Good idea.
works...
@~Publicality~: I am actually testing it. Seems to be good.

@~Publicality~: No, I just think that Zeronet has calculated with so stupid users than me. After deleting the index.html and reloading the site, Zeronet built a new index.html. Otherwise my blog would have been dead. Now I made a back of the whole folder.
I don't know how Zeronet takes care about the index file.
@Diligentslacker: üëç
@1pgallery: Of course. üëç
I am at ZeroMe Reloaded now. What is the advantage here in comparison to ZeroMe? Except from some different colors (needs a dark theme) I see nothing more than in ZeroMe.
I use many deep webs. In my eyes Zeronet is on a very good way.
What would you like to improve?

I tested ZeroMe Reloaded and ZeroMe Plus.
I am back on ZeroMe. :-)
I like the dark theme and it does all I need.
@Klu9: üëç
I use Vivaldi since yesterday and love it. But I tried to view a video on [DTube](https://d.tube). That didn't work. I changed to Chrome and the video started instantly. Hmm.
sleep well ;-)
@Hexator: A good decision. ;-)

@~Publicality~: Haha, I would die with only one meal a day. It is a good way to have a late breakfast and sit together with the family, talking and eating. I like brunch. But at dinner I'm hungry again. :-)

@~Publicality~: For beginners I ever recommended _Linux Mint_. It is good for Windows changer and easy to handle.
To tell the truth, on Linux you have to use the console (commandline) at some time. The old Linuxer know that working with the keyboard is much faster and easier than clicking around with the mouse. I often work with the terminal (also commandline) and on one machine I have only the console and no colored fancy GUI. :-)
I love it to work on it. You can learn it fast.
@~Publicality~: Why not. We don't celebrate Christmas either. We do not got to church or something else. We just like the family life, when all are coming and we are together.
@Androiduser: Done! Sorry for that. Normally I do this. It is late here. :-/
@Pexo: Replicant is surely good, but it is only for a handful of devices. Only Samsung and a Nexus.
@Realjohndoe: Thx, I will take a look.
@Klu9: Sailfish OS seems to be pretty good. There is an official contract with Sony. Sounds interesting. Thanks for this tip.
Nothing for kid at 12, if this is your true age. (I doubt)

@Styromaniac: Ah okay. Perhaps I am too old for that. :-)
And in Tor some users ware fishing for cp with that sentences.

All I read so far in the net ends up to 2 solutions:
- Buying a Sony Xperia and Sailfish 
- Waiting for the Librem 5
As I do not like so much the Xperia the solution is only one. I will wait for the Librem 5 in hope that it will be good enough for daily tasks.
@Alt3: I have absolutely no problem with that. Freedom is freedom for all here.
@Pexo: Yes, the specs sounds nice. I follow the development and hope they can hold the date around April for sale.
@Klu9: Okay, sry. I`ll correct this. thanks.
Welcome on the good site of the net. :-)
@Pexo: Thank you. I corrected everything as you advised.
@Pexo: Yes, it is similar to steemit. I test this media. It is a beta version.
